item.title: New Sig
item.dc:creator: @ThAt0n36Uy Elijah
item.description:
@ThAt0n36Uy wrote:

Nah, not exactly what I meant. you can work with that though. Put the thin part of the C4D that was traveling up the right side, next to the one I told you to remove. Turn the opacity up on the light, back to what it was, or a little less, and then move it to the right 18 px, behind his head. Return that black box that I told you to move down, and delete the two lines beneath it, and move it down accordingly. Move the C4D at the top down and to the left some. To make up for the removed one. You could also place something in that blank space too if you wanted, maybe a render similiar to the one you have on there, like a batallion of soldiers.

EDIT: If you still have that C4D try and take the piece you deleted, rotate it, and make it come out of the soldiers right elbow.

Read full topic

item.title: New Sig
item.dc:creator: @ThAt0n36Uy Elijah
item.description:
@ThAt0n36Uy wrote:

I highlighted some problem areas. They don’t have to be fixed but the might improve it a little. Get rid of the abstact thing on the right. Leave the little one I didn’t circle though. There is a small circle at the elbow of the render, fix that. I circled the light because it is too bright, turn down the opacity on it. Or darken it. It makes the render hard to look at it. I also circled the little black thing to the left of the light. Move that down, like 23 px. Post back here with the results.

Read full topic

the problem with the outline is the destruction of flow… I don’t wanna go too far with

item.title: New Sig
item.dc:creator: @I_Br3ndan_I I Br3ndan I
item.description:
@I_Br3ndan_I wrote:

The render’s the problem here. You’ve made it a problem though, because of the bright colours elsewhere - no offense. It’s as if he blends in with the background.

Your newer one’s a little better, but I think you could go a little more brighter with the blue outline, it looks more or less the same to me.

Read full topic

item.title: New Sig
item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

A light touch does it. I know that flow is very important, but I think you made it flow too well. Because the right side is especially bright, the eye is drawn there. But you want your eye drawn to the person, not to a bright light. Emphasize that character.

Of course, if a gfx guy wants to jump in and correct me, feel free.

Read full topic

item.title: New Sig
item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

Way too much going on. Not enough focus on the character. I had to look a few times to see what the heck is going.

Possibly, put a slight light blue outer glow around the character.

item.description:
@I_Br3ndan_I wrote:

I prefer the one with the text. It’s kinda like the wording is on the wall naturally. It is a wall, right? I dunno, I immediately thought of a military base with white letters painted on the wall and the text helped me recreate that idea through your picture even more.

Know what I mean? Anyway yeah, I think it’s good because of the things I mentioned.
